DataElement.preferredName: Hospital Specified Surgical Procedure Approach 2010 Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Used to describe the method of surgical approach used for patients undergoing surgery of the primary site at the reporting facility.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Describe the method of surgical approach used for patients undergoing surgery of the primary site at the reporting facility.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An institution that provides medical, surgical, or psychiatric care and treatment for the sick or the injured.:Specified; clearly and explicitly stated.

Concepts.definition: An institution that provides medical, surgical, or psychiatric care and treatment for the sick or the injured.

Property.preferredDefinition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.:A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Describes the method of surgical approach used for patients undergoing the most invasive, definitive surgery at the reporting facility.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Unknown whether surgery was performed; Patient record does not state whether a surgical procedure of the primary site was performed and no information is available.  Death certificate only.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Unknown whether surgery was performed; Patient record does not state whether a surgical procedure of the primary site was performed and no information is available.  Death certificate only.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Unknown whether surgery was performed; Patient record does not state whether a surgical procedure of the primary site was performed and no information is available.  Death certificate only.

Surgery done using a laparoscope.::1: The act of changing the nature, form, function, or purpose of something to another.::2: Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.::3: Affording unobstructed entrance and exit; affording free passage or access; accessible to all.::4: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Concepts.definition: The act of changing the nature, form, function, or purpose of something to another.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
Affording unobstructed entrance and exit; affording free passage or access; accessible to all.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  WZhang, 02/23/2015

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: No surgical procedure of primary site at this facility.  Diagnosed at autopsy.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: No surgical procedure of primary site at this facility.  Diagnosed at autopsy.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No surgical procedure of primary site at this facility.  Diagnosed at autopsy.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Division of Cancer Control and Population Sciences
